meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: WHO WILL MAP THE MAPPERS?

div.a: How Google Builds Its Maps—And What It Means For The Future Of Everything

div.div: An exclusive look inside Ground Truth, the secretive program to build the world's best accurate maps.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Qp42NQ&via=Digg&text=How Google Builds Its Maps—And What It Means For The Future Of Everything

div.div: THE FUTURE

div.a: Retro-Futuristic Fixes For Fighting Skyscraper Fires

div.div: As the world's cities grew into the skies, futurists, designers and scientists came up with ingenious solutions for fighting fires in the world’s tallest buildings.
DRUGS
Mounting evidence shows ‘cannabinoids’ in marijuana slow cancer growth, inhibit formation of new blood cells that feed a tumor, and help manage pain, fatigue, nausea, and other side effects.
POLICY

div.a: How Romney Out-Debated Obama On Science

div.div: Scientists and science enthusiasts don’t make up a big chunk of the electorate, and they tend be Democrats. But Obama’s campaign team shouldn’t take them for granted.
STREET (ART) CRIME

div.a: Did Zara Rip Off The 'Moustache Man'?

div.div: Patrick Waldo, a New York-based street artist, claims that international retail chain Zara copied his iconic art in a new $16.90 T-shirt.
INTERACTIVE

div.a: Where Does Most Of The Public Urination (And Other Petty Crime) Happen In New York City?

div.div: This map shows the top 15 categories of "pink slip" summons issued by each precinct of the New York City Police Department during 2011.

li.div: Important map:MT @alykatzz: See which nabes get the most #NYPD summonses. thenewyorkworld.com/public...

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Q06BXg&via=Digg&text=Where Does Most Of The Public Urination (And Other Petty Crime) Happen In New York City?

div.div: READ ALL ABOUT IT

div.a: Amazon Announces New Kindle Fire HD, Paperwhite E-Reader

div.div: Amazon showed off an entirely new line of Kindle products at a launch event on Thursday afternoon.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NeJCYi&via=Digg&text=Amazon Announces New Kindle Fire HD, Paperwhite E-Reader

div.div: TOP CHEF EPISODE SUGGESTION
The search for a set of three foods – where any pair go together, but all three do not – is generating some tasty debate.
HE DOES IT LIVE

div.a: Inside Bill Clinton's Epic Democratic Convention Speech

div.div: The draft of the former president's remarks given to reporters was 3,136 words. He made a few changes, and went nearly twice as long.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QosSgP&via=Digg&text=Inside Bill Clinton's Epic Democratic Convention Speech

div.div: NSFW

div.a: What It's Like To Be Harassed On The Internet

div.div: There are some truly terrible people in the world, and they also have internet connections.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NbDdgo&via=Digg&text=What It's Like To Be Harassed On The Internet

div.div: PHOTOGRAPHY

div.a: How National Geographic Spots Fake Photos

div.div: How does National Geographic detect manipulated or otherwise inadmissible submissions among the massive volume of entries to their Traveler Photo Contest?

li.div: Another argument against ethical absolutism: poynter.org/latest-news/re... National Geographic Traveler allows some manipulation of contest photos.

div.div: THE DONALD

div.a: How Donald Trump's Ancestor's Struck Klondike Gold

div.div: Long before 'the Donald,' his stampeder grandpa's seedy restaurant gave birth to a glittering dynasty.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RPOM9F&via=Digg&text=How Donald Trump's Ancestor's Struck Klondike Gold

div.div: DISASTERS WAITING TO HAPPEN

The pressure in Mount Fuji's magma chamber is now higher than it was in 1707, the last time the nearly 4,000-metre-high Japanese volcano erupted, causing volcanologists to speculate that a disaster is imminent.
WE'RE GETTING IMPATIENT

div.a: Why The Home Of The Future Is Still Years Away

div.div: Experts say there are several reasons why the uncabled home, which became possible with the advent of Wi-Fi networks, has been slow in coming, with consumer indifference, the cost of consuming wireless data, the global recession and competing technical standards among them.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OV5vIB&via=Digg&text=Why The Home Of The Future Is Still Years Away

div.div: INFOGRAPHICS

div.a: How Do Kids End Up In Adult Prison?

div.div: Every year, throughout the United States, a quarter of a million people under the age of 18 are tried in adult courts, and thousands of juveniles end up in the adult prison system. Why is this happening?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/P2TZ18&via=Digg&text=How Do Kids End Up In Adult Prison?

div.div: GUESS THEY DIDN'T USE GORILLA GLASS

div.a: Robbers Crash A Car Into An Apple Store

div.div: Apple's Promenade Temecula retail store in Temecula, California was reportedly hit by smash-and-grab robbers last night.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OXCGeE&via=Digg&text=Robbers Crash A Car Into An Apple Store

div.div: TELL US MORE...

div.a: How To Run A Nuclear Reactor

div.div: The Reed Research Reactor is the only program in the country where undergraduate students oversee the day-to-day operations of a working nuclear reactor.
DEADLY DREAMS

div.a: Can You Die From A Nightmare?

div.div: "It was creepy to wake up violently in the middle of the night. It was creepier when no one could tell me why it was happening."

li.div: Truly fascinating, fairly terrifying, incredibly good piece by @doreeshafrir on her battle with night terrors: buzzfeed.com/doree/can-you...
